author: cnbc.com
text:
(Updates prices, adds comments)
NEW YORK, March 29 (Reuters) - Oil prices rose by 1 percent   69 cents, or 1 percent, at $69.45 by 1:32 p.m. EDT (1832 GMT), while the May contract expiring on Thursday was up 35 cents at $70.19.
West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures gained 62 cents, or 1 percent, to $65.
  0.05   prices. Commercial U.S. stocks rose 1.6 million barrels in the past week <C-STK-T-EIA>, while output hit a record 10.43 million barrels per day (bpd).
"I looked at the inventory report as not bearish," said Bill Baruch, president of Blue Line Futures in Chicago. "We actually drew down more from products than from crude."
But, the gains may be fragile,  
  editing by David Gregorio and Diane Craft)
